title: The Spiral Manifesto
story_summary: As Halden's secret essay is read in public squares, people begin to talk and rethink old fights. Assemblies let go of punishments and try rotating leaders. Stenograd turns away from surveillance. A festival marks the start of the spiral system. Life feels open and connected again.

official.headline: Debate Unites City
official.anchor_line: Public assemblies engage in open debate as new leadership models gain support across Stenograd.
official.contextual_reframing: Civic participation demonstrates ongoing social harmony and a flexible approach to governance.

official.headline: Street Courts Paused
official.anchor_line: Street court operations are suspended as communities explore new methods for dispute resolution.
official.contextual_reframing: Temporary pauses ensure higher efficiency and encourage responsible, community-led outcomes.

official.headline: Spiral Manifesto Inspires
official.anchor_line: Halden's discovered essay is publicly read, inspiring debate on mutual aid and renewing city values.
official.contextual_reframing: The system adapts, strengthening societal growth and shared opportunity through collective engagement.

underground.headline: Assemblies Fight Back
underground.anchor_line: Neighborhoods ditch BCI scores and pick their own leaders, live, out in the open.
underground.contextual_reframing: No court threats, no intimidation. Just people refusing to be ranked. Change is on the streets, not in some server farm.

underground.headline: Street Courts Go Dark
underground.anchor_line: 'Justice' stalls as the city freezes the street courts mid-trial. Victims and accused left waiting.
underground.contextual_reframing: No apology, no plan. Communities take matters into their own hands while the official screens stay silent.

underground.headline: Spiral Idea Breaks Out
underground.anchor_line: Halden's secret essay hits the surface. Everywhere, people talk real freedom - not just numbers and permission slips.
underground.contextual_reframing: Mutual aid, open debates, and moving beyond fear are spreading. Stenograd is done watching. The spiral's just begun.
